content: One of the best recorder. Highly recommended. Developer is quick to response. Guys, go for this, if worth your money.
ich habe viele Recorder getestet. der Klang der Aufnahmen (WAV) ist überragend viel besser als der aller anderer recorder apps! flexibel an Mikros und usb-Sound Karten anpassbar. super dokumentiert!

One of my favorite apps. Galaxy Note5 and Chromebook Pro. Using it with Sonic Presence binaural mics, via USB, or mono using the builtin. Got an XLR3 to TRRS cable to use with an AT battery powered shotgun mic. Excellent interface, easy to drive.

Worked great for years, then recently quit letting me record. Developer did not respond to requests for help. I paid for this app, but now cannot use it and have to look for an alternative. UPDATED 2021-01-10: The developer did eventually contact me and was very helpful in working with me to solve this problem, which appears to be an unusual app interaction on my device.
replyContent: Thank you! If you should find out which other app caused the problem let me know: H.Pfitzinger@gmail.com

content: I've been using this for years and the author nicely changed the file names length for me and fixed a few bugs. It's a great product. I think the automatic pause functionality needs a little finer grain tweaking ability because every phones microphone is different but I don't really use the voice detection thing much now.
replyContent: Hi Michael. Just touch the send button (with the orange arrow symbol pointing upwards) and then choose "via other services". Then, you find e.g. Google Drive or Dropbox. This is not fully automatic, but instead it is fully save which is also an important feature, especially these days.

content: @Developer, I have version 9.2, but will not write to SD card. Its the only reason why Im not giving this app 5 stars, this recording app is amazing but no access to SD for recording. 👎👎
replyContent: Would you please try the new Field Recorder version 9.3 and report to me personally (H.Pfitzinger@gmail.com)?

content: The most painful user interface I have ever paid for. Don't recommend.
replyContent: Please let me know what exactly is so painful? We are able and willing to improve the interface. Did you try the new Field Recorder version 9.3? We changed the menus a bit. You can mail me directly: H.Pfitzinger@gmail.com

content: 3 annoying bugs in version 9.2: 1) to start a new file have to quit and re-open, otherwise adds up to the last recording; 2) keeps changing pre-sets at will, also a problem launching w/o internet access - takes it forever to "collect presets" that are already downloaded on the device! A nasty bug considering one would like to record undisturbed and therefore uses "flight mode" 3) all your settings are lost clean every time you close the app - see 1) for more annoyance!
replyContent: Please use the new version 9.3 (December 2020). Concerning your point 1: the option "Settings -> Rec > Start new recording at file..." should be set to "new" if you want a new file each record (this is the Factory default, so I wonder why in your case this strange behaviour)? You can mail me directly (H.Pfitzinger@gmail.com)

content: Just downloaded this app to use as a field recorder. It sounds incredible and there are a mind boggling amount of recording options. The GUI will take some time to learn but, it looks to be light years ahead of the other apps out there. Is there an in depth video tutorial available because I'm really going to need one! Honestly, if you're into Foley sound design or field recordings, £5 is an absolute bargain for this app. 😁
replyContent: Thanks, we think so, too 😁 We didn't produce a video but there is one at utube: https://goo.gl/gwL2EV

content: Love this App!
best
Stops recording after ~6 minutes and shows that the recording was 13+ hours!!!
replyContent: In Field Recorder's file selector is a button "Info". Please touch it then you have a "Repair" button with corrects this file to its real duration. The break down is due to Android's rigorous power saving ideas, that apps running in the background are allowed to get killed which is wrong for FR. Please contact me personally: H.Pfitzinger@gmail.com

content: I like this app and would probably give it 5 stars, but it wants to open every time I plug in my usb-c headset, and there's only "always open app" and "cancel," no option to never open automatically. And unfortunately, I can't find any option in the app or my Android settings that will turn that off. I'll of course change my rating if there's a way to do it that I'm missing!
replyContent: Yeah, this is unfortunately a dialog coming from Google's Android directly, and the important button "Don't show again" is missing. Please report this request to Google. They have to add it. We have absolutely no possibility to avoid this (we even analysed the source code of Android).

content: Update: Doesn't start without Google apps. Es ist echt der Wahnsinn was die kleinen Mikrofone moderner Smartphones mit Hilfe dieses umfangreichen und dennoch intuitiven Programmes leisten können. Die App ist definitiv jeden Euro wert und ich würde mir eine vergleichbar leistungsfähige und dennoch leicht zu nutzende Lösung für meinen Windows-Desktop wünschen.
replyContent: Google Play Store ist bei einer Kauf-App für die Installation notwendig und es gibt (auch für uns) keine Möglichkeit, das zu umgehen! Wenn der Play Store also vorhanden ist, dann läuft Field Recorder auch immer. Könnten Sie mir das Problem genauer erklären? -> H.Pfitzinger@gmail.com

content: Waste of money - 20 years out of date and buggy. Cant select custom save folder, cant save to cloud. Cant view list of recorded files. The list goes on. Honestly, this should be free, and even then there are much better options.
replyContent: Brief: "Cant select custom save folder": Touch "Settings -> Rec -> User-defined folder" to activate a file selector. "Cant save to cloud": Touch "Send"-button, choose "via other services" and select your cloud. "Cant view list of recorded files": Touch the big-lettered file name in the middle of the display area. Questions H.Pfitzinger@gmail.com

content: Best recorder available for quality on Android - period!

I use the talkback screen reader because I am blind. Unfortunately, this app is completely inaccessible for talkback users. Buttons& controls cannot be focused by swipe or touch and explore using talkback. This is a shame. I want to use this app, but the lack of accessibility makes that impossible.
replyContent: Tut mir wirklich sehr leid, für Talkback-Benutzer ist Field Recorder nicht besonders gut geeignet. Wenn Sie wollen, kann ich Ihnen das Geld zurückerstatten -> H.Pfitzinger@gmail.com

content: Best audio recorder hands down.
Wish it had 4 track capability
So glad that my favorite recorder works as advertised again! Good job, a little late but that can happen sometimes.
I don't really use this app enough. In other word, I don't record audio. However, this app is superior to many other sound recording apps that I've tried before.
Great recording app

Great app! For Android 10 users having problems recording files, click the settings button then Rec. Change the storage folder to the alternative and it should work. Unfortunately you will need to find your old wav files by plugging your phone into a computer.

Corrupted audio files are happening since using the app this weekend. Not all, but some. What have you changed to make this occur? I have not changed any settings since at least 6 months, which have resulted in acceptable audio levels.
replyContent:
You might imagine that this is an often asked question and you find our verbose answer in the FAQ section of our website (look for "English -> Gain -> Is there a way to reduce the input gain?"): https://goo.gl/UADxLE

An unfortunate fact is that Android offers no straightforward recording gain control! All you need to know is in our FAQ

content: Used to work great, but it is now completely broken with Android 10. Can't help but think this is due to inattentive development. Come on guys. I payed for an app that is now broken on my pixel.
Thank you for this recorder. Is fantastic! Only one question.. How I hear in headphone during record session, for monitoring control?
Really good app. Lots of options, 24 bit recording quality is excellent!

The recent Android 10 update has made the application redundant because of Scoped Storage. I get " Field Recorder is forbidden to write at the selected path" error message while trying to record. I'm not changing the rating for this app considering the effort that went into building this app. Kindly get this sorted sooner.
Did not work at all. Black screen. Google Pixel 4 XL Android 10.
I'm in the hell known as android 10. Scoped storage. How do I enable recording to my device now? I can't seem to just give it write permission anymore 😭😭😭

The app used to work great and still does, but only if I make it so my screen never locks. The app crashes and closes not every single time but VERY OFTEN. Which means I can't even use it. This behavior started with the last update.
replyContent: Thank you for the info. We'll look into it

content: This has been an excellent app for the 2 years I've been using it on an LG G6 running Android 8. The In:Raw input configuration has been wonderful for recording in loud environments. Unfortunately I just upgraded to Android 9, and this configuration no longer works--recorded files are just silence (same with In:MicC). Is there a way to fix this? I really want to use this app fully again.

this is the best app you'll find out there to record. i'm using for singing practice and it works as expected, which is the most important feature. so, is reliable. recording in raw mode removes some android artifacts i can hear if the option is not enabled. ok, the UI is kinda retro looking (i mean pre android 4.0) but sound is the key here.

I use this app for recording different instruments' parts during practice sessions of a samba bateria. It is very loud, and Field Recorder gives me the control I need to make it work. I also like the way the technical documentation is integrated into the app.
Was working but now it is forbidden to write to folder. Can't select new folder either. Unnstalling. Finally a decent recording app now I can't use it.
Excellent recorder. Bit daunting to get full potential out of settings. Is there English version of your website?
This is an awesome very reliable audio recording app packed loaded with features! I use it for all my shoots and has not proved me wrong so far. Thank you to the developers for this!
It's great. It works!
Excellent!

Wow, it works! A lot of apps just promise you that it works and there is no glitches, but this one is so PRO, so many options, and that's why I said goodbye to iPhone after 10 years :) Usb-c adater to 3.5 mm stereo mic and I have great way to record any audio effect with out walking with big bulky recorder. Thanks !
NEEDS an internal converter. The app is very professional but having to download an app WITH ADS! to convert its unacceptable! VERY anti professional. Other than this it's perfect.

So far, I've been blown away. I use recorders frequently for recording instructions, meetings, new song ideas, etc, and usually phone recordings are absolutely atrocious. This app allowed me to record stereo mics without the shoddy noise reduction or automatic level adjustment that my phone's manufacturer has installed. It's also got lots of settings that I'll probably never use, but hey, they're there if you need them. Some users complained about unintuitive UI. I didn't have an issue with it.
Very good app. Could improve playback navigation.conversion to flac or mp3 ogg would be nice to have.

The recording sound quality (using my galaxy note 9) is simply amazing. I played a few seconds of a session back to a patient and he thought that I was still speaking to him. To someone who is not an audiophile the interface is daunting. Could I suggest that the initial screen simply present the various buttons (play, fast forward, stop etc. and maybe volume gain) with a "More" button to open the next screen for more advanced options. This would make it seem more user friendly.
replyContent: Thank you for the positive assessment and for the suggestion how to improve the GUI. We'll seriously consider it

content: This has got to be the best recorder I've found so far, brilliant in every way, it even records audio from my usb sound card in hq which is very useful. I haven't found one fault with this
great recorder but definitely needs to have a fresher look. to much clutter. needs a UI change! I just sent you a design. But its your responsibility as a developer to hire a designer.
replyContent: Please let me know how you would prefer it to look like (maybe a photography of a hand-drawing?). I'm sure we can improve the look and feel

content: Best recorder for Android by far. Dev is responsive. Thanks. 6*
replyContent: Dev reagiert auch hier: Vielen Dank!

content: not worth the money. app works but is kinda limited where it really counts. functionality is fine but not what it could be. worth maybe 2.99 at best.
replyContent: Please let me know where you feel Field Recorder limited. I'm sure we can improve the features and handling.

content: Second review: I love app's features, but it often fails to load when I need it in the field!!! The only app the I've ever had fail after purchase saying I need to be online or email to get it to open. It's a FIELD recorder (i.e., a place without connectivity)! I posted this fact in previous review a year ago. They blamed google play. I went back to the field and it failed again, so it seems to be a problem with the app. You won't be able to trust this in the field unless you are always online.
replyContent: This stop was caused by a faulty update of Google Play app and was running again after the follow-up update. We did everything to solve the problem and the new version 8.2 is more relaxed with "impossible" cases like this. You can trust Field Recorder! Any device especially hardware can break so for unrepeatable recordings I recommend backup device

content: I have used this application for a little over four years (...I think... wasn't keeping track) and never had a need for another one. I've dabbled in other applications as well, but none have been able to exceed this one in terms of practicality. If you care more about the quality of your recordings than the interface itself you'll probably love this application. I just wanna' give a big hug and thank you to the developer. You're awesome and I couldn't be happier with my purchase.
replyContent: Thank you very much! You made my day

content: Powerful recording tool for the phone. Great features giving loads of options, more than I need at the moment but they're there for when I do. Top job, 5*+
I've tried the best free audio recorders and a couple are decent but none compare to the overall quality this app provides.
Meget bra, store fine knapper
best recorder for android
One of the best recorders I haved used.

Super cluttered to look at, doesn't give you an easy to find list of the recordings you've made... very complicated and i felt instantly like i had no idea what to do. maybe only get this app if you are an experienced audio head who will understand all the complex settings. I'd like to get a refund but i can't find contact details for the developer. :(
replyContent: If you have a suggestion how to reduce the "cluttered look" please let me know. You get the list of recordings by touching the big-lettered file name in the middle of the display area. If you like to contact me just email me: H.Pfitzinger@gmail.com Or look at the "Send"-button: there is a section "Communicate with us".

content: Very good
Simply the Best field recorder for Android.
Great most fully featured recorder but difficult UI.
replyContent: Any idea to improve Field Recorder, even if it is only hand-drawn, is very appreciated. Maybe it would bring us to a better GUI

content: I can't select loudspeaker for audio preview with external mic plugged in headphones. It think i have headphones plugged in. we need to be able to choose the audio output for previewing recorded clips. EDIT: The response given is absolutely incorrect so I downgraded from 3 stars to 1 star. Android does allow for a program to override audio settings. I think permission is called MODIFY_AUDIO_SETTINGS. In fact I use an app called Audio Router to force Field Recorder to output audio to Loudspeaker only. So is indeed possible. Furthermore the program stutters recording. There are many other recorders some are free which do not stutters. I don't understand the implementation but based on the response on how audio cannot be rerouted and is nothing they can do about it seems to me the creator is a can't do attitude unwilling to work with their users.
replyContent: Thank you for your feature request at the details: A future version of Field Recorder will allow to select speakers instead of headphones. Concerning recording stuttering it would be very helpful to get your settings. We have an Xperia Z5 here and so would be able to reproduce it. If you're interested please contact me: H.Pfitzinger@gmail.com

content: The best recorder app for Android. 2 big wishes. First, I know you have said you won't... But we all beg of you. Please make an Ios version? Lol. And two, would blow everything else away with no chance if you made a cool audio editor hehe.
replyContent: From time to time we question old decisions but new developments take time ...

content: Very powerful but the worst UI in existence.
replyContent: We're totally open to constructive critique so if you can specify what exactly you dislike, or even suggest an improvement, we will seriously consider it. Due to maximum 350 letters answer limit here, it is better to contact me directly: h.pfitzinger@gmail.com

content: Update: changed review after developer fixed!!! I love the way this so works. Previous: App no longer continues to record when screen locks. I am running Anroid Pie. This functionality used to work.
replyContent: This forced recording stop is fixed in the Field Recorder version 8.4

content: Best audio recorder around that I've tried. Boat loads of options for every situation, it seems. Well done.
We use this for recording band practices. Quality is excellent.

Bought and Have Been Using this Application Since at Least 2015. Keeps Getting Better Even if the Updates are Few and Far Between. From my Perspective, I View This As An; "Already Very Well Written & Fully Functioning Program of Professional Quality". It is Comprehensive, Elaborate & Highly Configurable. I Have Certainly Bought and Used Many Other Recorders Prior and Since, But in my Opinion, This "Gem Of A Recorder" Has Definitely Always Been One Of My Favorites! Enjoy...

Pro app, use it for recording video talking heads and it helps enormously 
when I don't have a sound recordist working with me.

This app is outdated and cumbersome to use. It stops recording when the 
screen is locked. Even free recorders have the option to keep recording 
when the screen is locked and off. Now I'm stuck with this app with no 
option of a refund.
replyContent: We fixed the forced recording stop in the Field Recorder version 8.4 Please try it. If you're still unhappy with Field Recorder let me know and I refund you manually

content:
The app opens when my phone starts, then sporadically and without prompting 
during regular use, which is disconcerting.
replyContent: It's not Field Recorder responsible for that behaviour. In your Android settings in the apps section seems to be a link to an action like e.g. headphones or USB device plugged-in. Just remove this link

content:
Have used this excellent app for more than 18 months. UPDATE: Previous 
review noted a licencing issue that was caused by a Google server problem, 
not by the app itself. Field Recorder app and and app author's support are 
first class, highly recommended!!

This application works so beautifully on my Google Pixelbook and the full 
screen interface is fabulous to use on the large touchscreen. Apparently 
the Pixelbook contains four very high quality sensitive microphones, so I 
just set for Mic A and get absolutely pristine brilliant recordings. I am a 
recorder nut and have many portable devices including Sony M10 and Boss 
BR-800 and this application on my Pixelbook is easily on par with both, 
perhaps even better. Very impressed!

Excellent and flexible Field Recording App that has very high sample rates. ...I mainly use it to record any interesting sounds I hear on the fly so I can us it in my own sound design in my music production ...handy for recording foley, background noises, machinery,  birds, waves etc etc)
Great app! I especially dig the interface, which offers much more detail than I'm used to on a smartphone.

I changed this app down to one star because even though I paid for it it 
will not let me open it to use it, and I am missing recording opportunities 
because of it. I will never use this application again. I think I'm owed a 
refund.
replyContent: Versions higher than 8.1 handle the problem you had in a better way (it was a problem caused by a faulty Google Play app update and disappeared immediately after they updated it again). I'm really sorry for this and as you know we did everything to solve the problem as fast as possible. Isn't this worth more than only one star?

content:
Made a 90 minute recording of a concert, went in to listen to it, and 
accidentally pressed record. It wiped out the entire recording. Didn't even 
ask to confirm if I wanted to overwrite the file.
replyContent: Field Recorder can't overwrite files without active intervention of you: Either during playback you press the Pause button, then Record, and finally Pause or Record again. Or you changed the option "Settings⇾Rec⇾Start new recordings at file..." from "new" (which always creates a new file if you press Record) to "play pos". But then you see an alert

content: Is there a way to adjust the microphone level?  Normal conversational levels in quiet room come out okay, but anything louder is unusably clipped.
replyContent: Hi Gordon, did you check our FAQ webpage: https://goo.gl/UADxLE . There's an English section with your question as the first one. For further support please drop me an email: H.Pfitzinger@gmail.com

content: Definitely the best recorder app- and one of the most valuable apps in the world of smartphones and tablets. Great deal of solid, honest work, deserving every penny of its price. Sure, there is always something to add or improve, and it is done with every new version. Great companion, when you can't or don't want to lug your separate handy recorder with you.

Best audio recorder for android. Far more superior than anything available. With each new update, it becomes better and better. Thank you for your wonderful work.   A request, if possible.. to add an option to control the speed of the audio. Slower and higher rate than normal speed. And maybe an option to play the audio in reverse. That would be really just perfect. Thanks again  A little error I get after deleting a recorded clip. It remains in the list of recordings with a message "can't read file header" and I must delete the file once more. This happens every time I delete an audio file from the app. Not a big deal but gets annoying sometimes. Thanks

Needs enhancement features. Needs a directory search from the app for recorded wav clips and the ability to rename the recordings files from within the app. Also it only plays back the last recording made so if you have made several you can't play earlier ones back from within the app. Also if you don't convert each recording to mp3 as you finish each one, you can only convert the last recording made from within the app
replyContent: The recordings overview opens if you touch the big-lettered file name in the middle of the display area. Then a menu pops up showing the path of the files in the headline and for each file mono/stereo, sample rate, and duration. It also shows all amplitude envelopes to easily recognize a file. At the bottom are buttons for rename delete play choose

content: Used on lenovo tablet it really brought it to love, can now use quality usb Mike. Very good program and worth the expense

Great app just wish could record some streaming audio for sampling works  .if there is a way to record from other playing apps e.g. vocals with a track playing from streaming content just for better dictating ideas in a mixed sense  ...
replyContent: Thank you! Unfortunately, Android strictly prohibits internal recording of audio streams of other apps (probably due to copyright). So there's absolutely no possibility to enable that (except recording with a microphone the audio coming out of the speaker)

content: Great, fully featured audio app. Just one thing I wish it had: While you can increase the gain of the microphone, you can't decrease the gain below zero. I'm a motovlogger and I use a lavalier microphone plugged into my phone to record audio. It would be nice to be able to decrease the input gain, so I'm not producing clipped audio. Something to think about!  I have low recording gain selected and boost is set at -5dB. My lavalier's signal is still too hot. Are there other settings I could try?
replyContent: Yes, there are. Please see our FAQ at our website: https://goo.gl/UADxLE (1st question in the section "English"->"Gain"). Then, you'd understand that it's not Field Recorder's fault: We enable our users to access anything Android offers to bring gain down, but you should know that Android offers no simple straight-forward gain reduction

content: One word, Pro

Absolutely love it. It can pretty much fulfill any recording task you throw at it. It gives you full control over the sound, and it's pretty simple once you get the hang of it. Well worth the money. (Do not get carried away with the gain settings. It can damage speakers)
No matter which preset I use, I'm hearing the cricket sounds during playback. The support for this app sucks too, I emailed the guy a few questions, but he never responded.
replyContent: Hi Jack, my answers probably slipped into your spam folder? I noticed that you also wrote to our forum so I'll answer there (hoping that we have a direct contact there).

content: Sounds good, but can record from my USB sound card via line in port
replyContent: What exactly is the problem? The USB connection does not work? If it does not, then this is a problem of the Android 5.0 version of your HM Note 2 phone. Maybe an Android update could solve the problem. Please contact me via H.Pfitzinger@gmail.com

content: Incredible app definitely worth every cent. I got myself a saramonic smartrig+ to use with this and it almost sounded like a $400 field recorder but in reality with the preamp only cost a little over $100. Only the best and I can tell you I have tried a lot of apps but none of them are this good

Love the features. However, my version says that it's outdated and it will produce huge CPU usage and that a new version will solve it. But where is this new version on the play store? I'm on version 7.0.2. I'm on Android Oreo 8.0 if that makes any difference. *UPDATE* App automatically updated itself the next day to 7.1. Not sure why it took that long but thx to the developer for replying to my concern.
replyContent: Thank you! This shouldn't happen. The new version 7.1 unrolls too slow since a couple of days. Anyway, it should be available to you any minute. You might force it by searching for Field Recorder in Google's play store. Then, its page should have an update button. We've too many users of outdated versions, so we encourage them to use the newest one

content: I have all the best recorders and multi-track recorders and this app rocks the top. I am a self professed sound expert and the developers of this app are as well. Buy it!!!!! Buy it!!!!!
Great App
Great recording. Crystal clear. Slick UI. Thx!

I don't know if it's my phone or what but this app takes really crappy recordings. I have a Samsung Galaxy S7. I bought a Zoom H1 and records WAY BETTER. Not even a comparison. I record live concerts tho so for something in an office maybe it's ok but I wouldn't know.
replyContent: Please go back to "Factory" (i.e. touch the framed area on the left below the big-lettered file name in the display area and select the top entry "Factory" in the upcoming preset list). Then test the input configuration "In:MicC". It sounds way better. Or please send me a short recording (5 secs) to analyse: H.Pfitzinger@gmail.com  Problem solved?

content: Perfect for broadcasters ... I use it with a field/handheld USB mic on my smartphone, and have the EQ section carefully adjusted for a near studio quality sound. No more anemic, tinny sounding recordings from on-location assignments.

Great for E.V.P'S,  bought this based on what i read about it. used it last night in hopes of recording an evp was able to successfully record two evp's with this app, woks better tham i expected, great app!
how to record a new file? i click the record button but it keeps playing the previous file..can't find any help in the settings it's too complicated
replyContent: Field Recorder is able to override previous recordings. To avoid unintentional overriding by accidentally touching the recording button during listening to a precious audio file, you need to press Stop (then Record creates a new file) or Pause (then Field Recorder changes to Record-standby and a 2nd press overrides the rest of the old file)

content: Αfter a first try it seems to record a great quality sound.Thank you for the video below
replyContent: Typically, you need a USB-OTG-adapter to connect any USB audio interfaces to your Android (https://goo.gl/AO3RBJ). But the SS08 from Optivelox has a built-in adapter and a micro USB plug, so you just connect it and it works. The only video tutorial I know is https://goo.gl/gwL2EV but there's still lack of more. If you want to make one let us know

content: Love this app! Feels just like my recorder and makes stealth taping a piece of cake! I use a pair of sound professionals in-ear binaural microphones/power supply with an Andrea Android adaptor going into the mini USB, works great!  Much more user friendly than my previous app (RecForge 2pro), this has a great interface and the sound quality is outstanding!
Great recorder. UI can be a little overwhelming at first, but read the help guide and it will make sense. Options galore once you understand the UI.
Genial einfaches Interface.

Please add 24 bit sound support in it, my phone Xperia z5 premium support 24bit audio but no 24bit sound option in the app, also ACG cannot be disabled in this app, it's grayed out, please add support for phone model, also add 50hz filter, it only has 60hz filter. There is no help guide in app. Add that as well. Thanks.
replyContent: If the device is capable of 24bit recording Field Recorder uses it by default. You can disable it with Settings➝Rec➝Use 16 instead of 24 bit sampling. The signal gets noise shaped to fit into 16bit files while maintaining more than 105dB dynamics. Low-cut 60Hz means -3dB@60Hz and -6dB@50Hz see https://goo.gl/FR076R AGC-help: H.Pfitzinger@gmail.com

content: Very sophisticated recorder. Works well with my LG V20. I love the control this app provides. Well done! I'll be buying pro version.
Can't get the media recorded off the phone. Sucks, because I have to get a new phone
replyContent: Please, let me support you. When you touch the big-lettered filename (or date&time string) in the display area, the file selection dialog opens. The top line shows the precise path of the recorded files. There're many tools to get this directory off the phone altogether. Just drop me an email: H.Pfitzinger@gmail.com

content: Easy to use, impressive, well thought out with lots of nice features. Worked well on Google Pixel. Better than any iOS recording apps I have used. Buttons look a bit plain but functionally is great.
Is there a way to use this app to record stuff playing on my phone not from the speaker but inside the phone?
replyContent: Unfortunately, Android blocks this option (probably due to copyright issues?). But you've 3 workaround options: 1) Record the speaker with the built-in mic (only mono, moderate quality), 2) Use a headset jack adapter which connects out and in (stereo only with Sony Z series, quality very good), 3) Use a USB soundcard and connect digital out and in

content: Despite its beauty, and the quality of sound it produces (selective devices)...on the s7 edge it can record in stereo. I know this because the meters and sound adjust based on position...not at all on the v20. The meters stay level. I tap each of the 3 mics and only the bottom one is activated in this app. And the sound is horrible. Its mono and its tinny on the basic setting. Meaning...its 3 stars when its reviewed as a whole encompassing app. Update the app when it can utilize all microphones (at least 2 on the v20) and I will update review. Through my headphones and this app, I will stick to stock app which uses both positioned at the top (camera hifi uses all 3).
replyContent: Did you try other than the basic settings (-> "Factory")? Obviously, the v20 is special. I would be happy to advise you finding the best settings for your v20 and purposes. Just drop me an email: H.Pfitzinger@gmail.com

content: This app is just what I needed. I had a bumpy start but the customer service was fantastic and prompt. All of my questions were answered. I use this app to record my band. So far, great!

I can't describe how great this recorder is. full of great & advanced features which you can't find in any other app. i was using RecForge 2 before this & i should honestly confess that they're not even comparable in recording quality. This app is by far the best Voice Recorder for Android.
48K wav setting makes it my go-to recorder for video work. Connect a trrs lav mic to a smartphone in someone's pocket. Great sound for a camera without ext mic.
Kind of a bummer, thought this would work with an external microphone
replyContent: Please try the original headset first. It has a microphone capsule half way along the cable. You'll see that Field Recorder uses this capsule as soon as you plug-in the headset. External mics that don't have a TRRS-plug need an adapter to work. For details see our website https://goo.gl/nqsfav/ or just drop me an email: H.Pfitzinger@gmail.com

content: Love the analist tool and recording quality!
Details are good
This is the best.  Anyone who hasn't tried this app is really missing out.  I really appreciate being able to have the recordings saved to my external SD storage.  Many thanks to the developer.
replyContent: Thank you! Reviews like yours really motivate us to make Field Recorder even better. You made my day!

content: im a sound designer and recording person and some problems are looking for a good recorder and microphones to go with it. im talking about other handheld ones. but this app does give much more, considering i carry my phone all the time. i can use my mics with this using an OTG connector no problem and love the layout and way it works. absolutely worth the price. now if you will excuse me i have to go record some things ;)
replyContent: Thank you! Just in case you should need any support or have a new feature idea, drop me an email: H.Pfitzinger@gmail.com

content: Good
Of many recorders I tried, it is first reliable and predictable. Also, GUI is like I myself designed it. Thank you.
I like how reliable it has been.  Who knew that my phone had 6 mics in it!
Terrific
It really  really needs a user manual in English to enable me to maximise it's potential. Instead of just guessing what to do. However the developer is helpful & responsive to my enquiries .
replyContent: We've got tons of information on our website goo.gl/LFWpTR Admittedly, it's a careless translation but we're working hard to improve it during the next weeks. Besides, you can either read the long explanation texts in the Settings, or ask in our forum goo.gl/W7IsU5, or ask directly per email H.Pfitzinger@gmail.com. We're known to answer immediately

content: I've used half a dozen different recording apps over the years. I was settled on Hi-Q Mp3 recorder for the last couple of years. It was easy to use mostly because it doesn't have many options. I decided to try Field Recorder when it was on sale. Complex because of all the options and I'm not keen on having to use media converter to generate an Mp3 but.... The quality and fidelity of the recordings is unmatched! Comparing Hi-Q to Field Recorder recordings of the same event was night and day.

I use a galaxy S6. I do a lot of choral recordings for my rehearsals and love the quality. But due to the close proximity and number of singers, the device peaks a lot. If I use the Low Recording Gain feature, I loose stereo capability and the gain is still the same.
This app could only do half of what I needed it too I needed to be able to analyze and reanalyze my own recording s and those if other using full spectrum
replyContent: Ian, sorry to hear that. If you prefer full refund now, please let me know. Field Recorder provides a high-resolution real-time spectrum during recording and recording stand-by that is absolutely accurate. It also automatically picks the maximum gain frequency and shows its level and value

content: I love this app, I can record in stereo with my note 4, and send it straight to my Gdrive, to download and process on my computer. Great functions give me total control over the quality of my recordings.
I tried several voice recorders, this one beats them all by a mile.

I own a Zoom H4n, and have spent over a decade producing interviews for radio. Was looking for  a recorder that would give me the ability to record interviews and copy on the go! Most importantly, I wanted the ability to actively monitor while recording, something not easily found on other apps!  So far, I am thrilled with the User interface which allows me to visually monitor the recording with ease. The options are very precise and allows me to tweak my preferred presets quickly and efficiently, and the audio monitoring thus far is not bad. I'm at about one second of latency, which is to be expected, and not too bad at all! My ideal set up would be to use a lapel microphone plugged into the mic jack and monitor the recording using a bluetooth headset. As I don't have the equipment at the moment (will arrive in a few days) I would like to know if this is possible, and how I can adjust the latency?
replyContent: Thank you! Concerning latency 1s is way above what Field Recorder usually achieves. Depending on the device, we often see less than 0.1s but that's still a serious delay so we recommend closed headphones. There're tweak options in the Settings--Rec--"Expert recording settings" section to reduce latency. I'll support you via H.Pfitzinger@gmail.com

content: It would be nice to send media files via ssh and/or SFTP.
replyContent: Thank you, Jonathan. We added your suggestion to our ToDo list

content: This app is a poor guy/gal's dream tool for just about any recording situation (where two tracks at a time are being acquired) ... a veritable Nagra or Sound Devices field unit rolled into an amazingly clean and cost effective package ... simply the best thing available when you consider all the tweaks that can be done on the fly , not to mention the supported work flow features ... Now if the time code or BWF file capability could be included that would be out of this world cool , but as it stands this is an awesome app ... RB (35 years in documentary film work)
I'm using two phones: Galaxy Nexus & Moto X 2013. Can the feature support both phones or either of them? Please comment, thanks.
replyContent: Touch the frame on the left below the date/file name in the display area. In the upcoming list scroll down to F.CallExmplA. Choose it and do a test call. Also try F.CallExmplB. If both don't work read this translated paragraph from our website: goo.gl/P5PzE0 On some phones you need to experiment with Field Recorder's parameters mentioned there

content: Excellent app, used with Nexus 5 and Nexus 6P with USB OTG recording via mixer/external Behringer UCA222.  Recording live DJ mixes with it, last recording with app was 5 hours long and recording was flawless.  For on the go recording, perfect.

I would like a refund because with a professional broadcast quality microphone there was sooooo much Hiss and poor quality recording. Other apps and devices proved much more effective. It doesn’t warrant it's price.
replyContent: Concerning the hiss: Field Recorder is the app with the lowest possible hiss. And it offers additional settings to find the absolute best configuration. Let me know if you like me to assist you. Concerning the refund there's no need to hurry, please drop me an email: H.Pfitzinger@gmail.com

content: Just bought it. Just a question. I go to concerts alot and like to get some songs to my recordings. How is this during a live rock show. Does the recording come out good?? What settings should I use or can you recommend when recording. For example , should I boost the sound, should I put the bass and treble up.  I need good setting so I can actually hear a professional recording.  Thankyou for your feedback on tis.  Ps can I record 2 hours continuously ??
replyContent: I've only 350 letters allowed here. So please drop me an email H.Pfitzinger@gmail.com In brief: With 48kHz/stereo the max file size is >3 hours. And Field Recorder offers seamless recording over file boundaries. The Note4 has good mics so your preferences decide if and how to adjust the EQ. Re: reducing the input gain see bottom of goo.gl/UADxLE

content: T.. This is the best app for Android there's no better rapid is the best app for Android in the world maybe the best app in the world aplicasiones best 500 stars I got a song in major radio stations with this application it hit number one superlexx potato don't tell anybody well you couTell you one thing this is the best recorder app for Android I've ever seen its way way way way better than the other best that you can think of nothing compares to it is way better trust that coming from the superlexx m*****

With each update it just gets better and better. Best developer feedback. Okay I emailed you and no reply. If only you would add manual gain control that can be used during recording. Think of it as the mic has a volume adjustment. I know it's possible.
Maximizes your devices recording capabilities... Very handy tool for collecting WAV samples...
Great recording quality! Very responsive, knowledgeable, and efficient developer.

Good selection of options. does what it needs, well. Records in un compressed format so it much easier to edit afterwards. Yes its on a phone or tablet  but delivers decent results with mic(s) on board... even better with USB OTG and propper sound box. Used on sgs 5 and samsung galaxy tab 4 10.1... flawless. Looks good too... :-)
replyContent: Thank you! In case you should have ideas how to further improve Field Recorder just drop me an email: H.Pfitzinger@gmail.com

content: On Samsung tablet A. Can leave it recording in the background.
Thank you for your help your  field  recorder  is the greatest works great thank you for an A+ APP GREAT JOB
replyContent: Just touch the big lettered string in the display area (which toggles between date+time and the name of the recorded file) to get to a file selector dialog. There you can delete an unwanted recording, choose another one, rename it, show detailed information, or quickly listen to it. For further questions please just mail me H.Pfitzinger@gmail.com

content: Wouldn't want an accurate reading. People might get caught. Thanks for nothing. Yay. I can measure my voice.
replyContent: We fixed the cutoff three years ago on your request but you never appreciated this. Pitty

content: I use this product together with Dragon Professional Individual. This combination allows me to wander around, dictating, instead of sitting at a desk. I push it to Google Drive and transcribe it on my desktop. This is far healthier than being hunched over my desk all day. The auto feature that only records when I speak is key to letting me think without fumbling with controls to pause and restart.
Great field recorder. Lets you boost microphone etc... Has settings fornrecording and playback... Great app...
replyContent: Thank you!

content: **Note: If you want to use a external mic than you probably need a external audio converter like the: RØDE SC4.** I work daily in the professional video making business and I must say this app is perfect for little semiprofessional project's where you don't wanna bing a lot of stuff to. This app comes close to a record device like a Zoom. The app is reliable so far, no crashes during record and no corrupted file's. I'm glad there is app like this. Great support and they're open for suggestions.
replyContent: The headset jack of your Nexus 5 is the TRRS type used in most phones (one Tip contact, two Rings, one Sleeve). So, your external mic must have a TRRS plug with the mic capsule connected to 2nd ring and sleeve. Or you need a standard adapter, rewiring the simple TRS plug of many external mics to the necessary TRRS plug. Then it will work for sure!

content: This is by far the best recorder app I've yet come across. It offers a comprehensive set of functions and settings, with 'help' text available with every setting, making it easy to learn and use.  Currently it's the only app I can find that offers 'professional' functions and a sophisticated user interface much like that found on high-end 'hardware' recorders.  Level meters with 'dB' indication and an interface that tells you how the audio you're recording, or playing back, is being processed are very useful indeed.  The developers are friendly, helpful, responsive, and promise further updates that will enhance it's functionality.
I rarely see very swift and kind support. Tq Mr Hartmut for your time and answering all my trouble. God Bless. :)
This is the recorder of all recorders. Truly loved it. Quality is at its best.
Brilliant developer support and a very good app which has managed to make a muffled sounding microphone record surprisingly well :-)

Great app! It offers all we need to get a professional audio with our smartphones. There is absolutely nothing like it out there. With the new update we got a great improvement: the possibility to disable AGC!!

I am very thankful for this fantastic piece of software. Being able to record guitar pieces all the while retaining reasonably authentic sound quality is all I could ask for, and what I asked is being delivered. The parametric eq is good enough to even out the worst inconsistensies of my cheap headset, turning bland to beautiful. Clipping is easily avoided. This application is well worth every cent and more.
Looked very promising, but suddenly failed too open, even after system and app cleaning and reinstall. Will switch to Voice Recorder Pro at this point. Disappointing
replyContent: Bruce, version 5.6 copes with your device that cancelled the requested and originally permitted bluetooth access. Please, give it a try. I'll fully refund you manually if you're not happy

content: I was on a video shoot at work and all of our audio decided to take a dump on me in one form or another. Low batteries, missing cords, etc. I didn't have time to rent additional gear so I decided to use my phone with this app to record dialog of the talent. I placed the phone near the subject, hit record, and we were golden. Not only was the audio useable, the signal was on level with the pro audio gear that we use. Metering is key. The GUI could use refinement though. Chunky.
This has replaced a portable digital recorder for most purposes. The only shortcomings are with my hardware (Nexus 4). Thoroughly recommend this app.
Galaxy Note 4

This is a very reliable and nicely featured recording app. I'm a sound engineer and musician and this app has all the features of a good stand alone recorder with the convenience of being on my phone. Works very well in stereo at 48KHz, 16 bit, uncompressed even with the internal mics on my Galaxy S6. Good job guys. Great app!

Cannot disable Automatic Gain Control on my Galaxy Note 4, so the recordings aren't right. Other freeware recorders can disable AGC perfectly. This app seems kind of amateur with a laggy GUI in settings and in the file selector. Can't step back and forth to hear things you just recorded, a basic feature on hardware recorders. The laggy scrolling filelist can't play files. Cannot even easily *play* a recording without pressing rewind and sitting there waiting for it to visually rewind like a tape machine.
This is the best audio recorder out their.
replyContent: On Gain Control, Noise Suppression, Echo Cancellation: "Settings--Rec--Access to hidden recording effects" makes accessible the seemingly available effects. Did you touch the emerging frame? The manufacturer decides whether an accessible effect really works internally or not and we have no chance to know that beforehand. It's only an add-on to test

content: I tried a few recorder apps but this one is the best by far! For example, it boosts the volume of my Motorola Moto G's recordings which were pitifully underwhelming before. - It desperately needs a manual, as the controls are initially not intuitive and the many options can be bewildering. A widget and the ability to delete multiple files at once would be nice, too. 5 well deserved stars.
Great sound, great controls, very low noise floor, Highly recommended! 5 stars!
Great recorder

An older version did not load - I could only see a black screen...so it was uninstalled and refunded ;( at first, than I still liked the concept so I paid for it anyway and contacted the developers who fixed it with my log files so 5 stars just for listening and caring...
replyContent: Thank you for contacting us. We're very interested in removing all possible bugs and with your help we were able to fix one. So, thank you for your cooperation

content: Finding that there is a sophisticated field recorder app of this level was really cool.  I have a Zoom handheld unit and was looking for a Roland, but I am very happy to try this with a music rehearsal tonight.  Using an Samsung S5 allowed me to use the external micro SD card, so I have no worries on capacity.  Would this be a 16-bit recording app?  Not sure, but it is impressive.  I'll write more after the recording session!
Excellent
I rely on this app.  I will evaluate again.
So far ahead of any other recording apps! I was beginning to think my recording quality was a limitation of the phone, then I tried this....I was wrong!
Uses the stereo microphones on Samsung zoom k, turning it into a fantastic recorder

I have a Blue Tiki microphone (USB) on 5.0. The Tiki mistakenly announces it has an output (its input only). By turning off 'auto-route' on the debug media options, I can make Audio Recorder pro work (since it allows selecting input and output device independently). But I cannot make Field Recorder work since it either gets both input and output from the Tiki (so silence), or both input and output from onboard mic/speaker (low quality). Would like to be able to say "output to android audio/speaker, input from usb'. Otherwise very nice.
replyContent: If you plug headphones into the phone while the Tiki is attached to the USB port, you will hear the audio coming from the Tiki, going through Field Recorder ("Monitor on") directly to your headphones. You can additionally increase volume by changing "Play 1:1" to e.g. "Play +10dB".

content: Seem to be having some issues with recording on my LG G3. I'm using an iRig Pre with a Shure PG27. Seems to be an AGC issue because I get a lot less hiss in apps that allow me to disable AGC but no one else does live monitoring which is why I love your app. I get the best results with Mic E but still getting hiss, big gain fluctuations, weird compression.  Any ideas?
replyContent: Field Recorder version 5.0 got a new option ("Settings -> Rec -> Access to hidden recording effects") to enable/disable e.g. AGC, NS or EC. Please try these new possibilies. We would be happy if you contacted us via email (H.Pfitzinger@gmail.com). We would contact you but due to privacy protection we never get any customer data

content: But UI is hard to understand

I was seeking a better sound recorder for my android, and chose this one because of the good reviews.  But what I got was light years beyond what I expected.  Is there an official owner's manual I can download?  I want to know how to use this app to the fullest.
replyContent: Thank you! The manual is still under construction. In the meantime you can either read the explanation texts in the Settings, or ask in our forum (https://groups.google.com/forum/#!forum/fieldrecorder), or ask directly per email. We're known to answer immediately.

content: + Tons of options for recording + Ability to monitor input + Nice interface

Did you know that if you change recording destination setting, all current recordings disappear?  I found out that you CAN record to SD card using the preset \sd\android\data\whatever.  It STILL killed all my current recordings after I tried to set an user-generated SD folder, and then switched it to one of the default ones again. After this, my recordings (not essential, thank God) were gone, so beware.
replyContent: Field Recorder knows only one way to delete a file: if you choose the button Delete and then OK. You suffer a famous Android 4.4+ restriction: on SD cards apps are allowed to write only to their own folders (in our case /.../data/de.pfitzinger.rec/files). Field Recorder reports write permission in red writing, see "Settings--Rec--Recordings folder"

content: I have a Nexus 5 and I tried about 5 or 6 different recorders, and this app provided the best quality and settings. I needed to tweak the settings quite a bit to get the best signal, but this app rocks! It's actually a limitation of Android itself that you can't directly control audio gain, but for most situations where the audio is quiet, this app works great. Unfortunately I haven't found any good audio app for android that works at loud rock concerts, because the base gain is simply not adjustable yet in the OS.

To access WAV files via USB on my Android 4.2.2 device, I first have to run a media scan (reboot does the trick).  The quick response by support made me adjust my rating from four to a full five stars!
replyContent: Sorry for the inconvenience. If you just check the option "Settings--Rec--Media scan after new recordings" then the media scan runs automatically after each new recording. Default is unchecked because the scan takes time and battery and is only necessary in cases like yours. But please let us discuss support questions via Email. We answer very fast

content: I've looked around, and there is no other audio recorder that can do what this one does.  It is full featured.  It's the only one I've found that has live monitoring, which is a must for any professional recording.  The options and features are many.  Very well made!  My only critique is that the interface design (GUI) could be better.  Some of the menus and buttons are hard to navigate.
Still waiting for that widget :)
replyContent: Yeah, we had some serious bugs to fix, but now, the widget is on top of the ToDo-list.

content: Can't name files. Text jumps around everywhere on galaxy note 3. Impossible to rename

I have been looking for an audio recorder with this much choice and flexibility for quite some time now, and I've finally found it!! Has tons of presets for the right recording situation, works extremely well with many different kinds of mics, and gives you the ability to tweak literally any aspect of the app! Monitoring, waveform display and pre-post recording are the cherry on top! Absolutely love this, and highly recommend it to anyone doing professional audio/voice recording!  The only thing needed now is USB mic support!

So far I am loving this; I have tried about 11 other recording apps.. NONE do live monitoring of what is being recorded, so this was GREAT. I wish I had just purchased this instead of wasting time trying the other ones. Love it.
Just rated from three to four stars I will try what you said and if everything OK I will give you 5 stars. Thank you for the quick response.
replyContent: It also depends on your Android version which I don't know. Please test the cloud presets "HandsFreeCall" and "NewCallRec" for the Note3. If the latter doesn't work tick the option "Settings->Rec->Disable monitor function". If you succeed please let other people profit and upload your preset to the cloud. Otherwise please email me for details

content: I am editing my earlier review and updating my rating of this app.  My problems are with HTC, it appears, and not with the Field Recorder.  The tech support for the the Recorder have been very helpful though, currently we are still working on the problem I discuss below.  The app itself works very well.   "From high-quality stereo recording..."  To quote above.  I am using this app on an HTC phone and it is supposed to be fully compatible.  When I switch it into "stereo" mode, I get stereo meters but they are both metering the same channel.  I know my phone is capable of recording stereo because movies are recorded with stereo tracks.  So what gives?  Very disappointed.   Other than that, it's a cool-looking app.  NOTE:  Somehow I have not received the emails from the maker of this product.  I think they may have been sent to my spam filter by mistake.  Apologies for posting this review without having the full information.  I will look at the suggestions and update my ratings accordingly..
replyContent: Thank you for your email. We will do anything to make this work because the HTC One M7 and M8 are important devices. But obviously some of them have problems with stereo recording: http://www.htconeforum.com/forum/htc-one-audio/2351-how-make-stereo-recording-not-shooting-video.html#post11277

content: I've never been able to record live music on my Galaxy. All the Android forums say that you can't attenuate loud input signals. All the other recording apps only give you the option to boost quiet signals. This app just blows them all away.

Been using this for a while and I'm quite pleased. I had some issues before as I didn't fully understand it all and it would stop recording no more than 30 min in, finally got around to get the right settings. The only thing that would make this better is the ability to edit the audio files such as trim and whatnot :)
Very satisfied so far. Great recording tool.

Sorry havent got to play with it much.  Did it already get input lvl control?? Hmm if its there im sure ill find it eventually. Oh well, very nice app.  Mos def get my two thumbs up!! Got it on sale! Which makes it even better!

On my Lg8.3 works very OK. Just a big missunderstanding is in my opinion the lack of gain controll!?? What you do with so any indicators wich you can't control at all. So far the only app doing this perfect is the Tapemachine. However the creators are working on it and I'm sure they'll do it!  In any case very reliable support and if you find a good presets you can have  fantastic results!!!! THANKS
replyContent: Did you touch "Boost off"? You can choose a gain of up to 50dB there. Version 4.4.1 has an additional "Calibrating" option which allows you to fine-adjust the gain in 0.2dB steps.

content: How many recording apk's are caring about delay times? Well this one does!!! The dev is very responsive to emails :-)

I'm currently using the Field Recorder on my Nexus 7 2nd gen tablet. I'm a noob to field recorders but I like what I see so far. One thing I'd like to see in the next version of this app would be a slate feature so you can sync in post production. Keep up the great work.

Pros: Feature set, GUI, configurable settings, l.e.d. style VU meters, and on sale (which puts it at a comparable price point for its competitors). Cons: Lack of recording formats such as mp3 (most common & desired) and ogg. No "browse" feature for SD card file path selection. Developer's website is in German only, requiring translation to view. *Sound quality is still being tested.
I can't believe the improvement in the sound quality from my crappy condenser mike on my DROID phone! I use it for casual home studio recording on my guitars.  Easily the best audio app I've tried.

i was looking to use my 2014 galaxy note to capture audio/monitor audio for my Videos.this app lets me do just that.similar to typical field recorders.very fast meters,i am shocked that this only cost $5.some things i would add is being able to record 48khz and easier setup using external mics.other than that this app captures amazing sound and is easy to use

If you use an Android phone or tablet, the Field Recorder app from Pfitzinger Voice Design is highly worth investigating. I discovered it a few weeks ago, and it now replaces my handheld digital recorder, my old DAT, and all other audio recording apps on my phones and tablets. The most valuable and used app of the 250+ on my phone.

This is a great recording app! The support is top notch. I've been unable to get the app to record in stereo on my HTC One. Upon reaching the developer, he jumped right on looking for a solution. As it stands, he believes there is a problem with the HTC One firmware. I trust by the number of communications from the developer, that he is actively working along with HTC to find a solution.
Works well in stereo and easy to use with good customer feedback

This is the best recorder! I was looking for a recorder app which has a low cut filter because if you're doing recordings  the go, where there might be noise from cars, machinery, engines, appliances on having a low cut filter cuts out much of the noise and makes the difference between the recording being useable or not useable. This app has the low cut filter and much more! Now with a reduced gain option for Samsung phones which is great in situations with background noise or where the subject is very loud
Excellent quality recording, easy to use app! Best paid app I've ever got!

Just needs the ability to adjust the input and it will be perfect. I use it to record my band when we are writing. Sounds great, but I have to put it outside of the door to our rehearsal studio so it doesn't peak. Add a limiter or input adjustment and I 'd give it 10 stars.
I appreciate the functions and settings of this recorder. The only thing I wish it had is a gain control function to better manage the level input.

This is the first Android recorder to have every professional feature available on the device with full control of everything you could ever want in software for a stereo Recorder. Now if 1 day he figures out how to get USB input recording beating the other app that does that now

This is a beautiful piece of software in some respects. We were looking for an app for a voice recorder that would record in wave and would provide feedback like audio level metering.  However, there are some user interface issues that preclude a wholehearted recommendation, at least for the 2.3 phone that was used for testing.  First, the indication of recording is way too small. The interface is dominated by the meters, and the two-touch record start can and often does fool the unwary - record button red, meters moving - looks like its running when it's not.  Second, playback after recording should be immediate, not requiring the user to rewind - this is not a cassette tape, after all.  Finally, the software doesn't obey the usual android conventions for using the menu button. It has its own, very tiny, settings button making it harder to use, at least on a phone.  Fix these UI issues and you have an absolutely fantastic recording app, probably the best out there.
replyContent: Your critique was very helpful to us. If you're willing to give Field Recorder a 2nd try but fear that you can't get rid of it if you don't like it again (because of no refund at the 2nd buy) we would certainly refund you manually.

content: Lots of advanced features and highly customizable. the best and most customizable recording app i could find. Auto pause, sped  up playback, it has it all! Good stuff!
